title: The selling price of 110 oranges in the price of 33 oranges. What is the profit percentage? - Quora

response.answer_text: Statement of the given problem,The selling price of 110 oranges is the price of 33 oranges. What is the profit percentage?Let C & S denote the cost-price & sell-price of an orange respectively.Hence from above data we get as follows,110*S = 33*Cor S = (33/110)*Cor S = (3/10)*Cor S = (1 - 70/100)*CThereforethe (negative profit =) loss percentage is 70% [Ans]
